messages.message: One more suggestion here. Can we add a parent ticket for each CVEID so that we can add notes about the CVEID? I have (for example) 23 tickets from the same CVE that I need to add notes to. Would be much better to add the note to a parent ticket.

Can u suggest this feedback in <#C04434K8MAP|> plz.

@Parvez can u check if this new jira state - "IN REVIEW" affect any automation, like in closing out the tickets.

Another request is to add the package name in the Jira title.

Currently we only have `[release][CVE-ID][service]`. So one has to click into the ticket to figure out which package it is referring to. Having it in the title (or “Summary” as it’s called) would be of huge help.

hey @Yash Botadra As i'm hearing the requirements, i created this common sheet to list :
• the baseline fields that we need from the customer (Col A)
• the fields that we will share with the customer after we triage/ fix a problem (ColB)
• rest of the internal fields  in JIRA (All fields will be in JIRA)
https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1jo5QtP75ZZCROWUJCYNaIKy_ZlL0J-hGMxAP9PwoaL4/edit?gid=511528513#gid=511528513

Hey @jayapandian.ponraj yes it will affect the automation, we only considering `TODO` , `INProgess`  and `Done`  states and having `INReview`  for automation doesn't make sense. But if you are using this state only for manually tracked issues then it will not affect our current logic
